Snippets

A collection of useful JavaScript snippets

Array Methods

.map()

Better than a for loop, creates a new array populated with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the array

.filter()

Just filters out everything that doesn't meet the condition you provide

.forEach()

Doesn't actually return anything, basically a cleaner for loop, just executes a provided function once for each array element

.includes()

Doesn't take in a function, just takes a single argument to check for

.sort()

Used to sort the elements of an array. By default, it sorts the elements as strings, which means it may not work as expected for numbers (so use something like .toString()) To properly sort an array of numbers, you need to provide a compare function as an argument.
